means: （愉快而懒散地）度过（时间）（常与 away 连用）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词或副词均含"但是，可是，然而，而"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: but, however, still, yet, nevertheless, while, whereas
means: but ： 口语常用词，语气较强，泛指与前述情况相反。
however ： 表转折关系，语气稍弱于but，连接性也弱一些，因而常作插入语。
still ： 语气强，多用于肯定句或疑问句。指尽管作出让步，采取措施或表示反对，但情况仍然如故，无所改变。
yet ： 常用于否定句，语气比still稍强。指不管作出多大努力或让步，仍达不到预期的结果。
nevertheless ： 指尽管作出完全让步，也不会发生任何影响。
while ： 表对比，一般可与whereas换用，但程度弱一些。
whereas ： 表对比，一般可与while互换。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词均可表示"当……时"引出时间从句。
means: when ： 所引导的从句，其谓语动词既可是持续动词，也可是短暂动词；谓语动词动作发生的时间可以与主句谓语动词的动作是同时，或之前、之后。
while ： 句中的谓语动词应为持续动词，不用短暂动词，谓语动作发生的时间通常与主句谓语动词动作发生时间是同时。
as ： 侧重指从句与主句的动作同时进行，谓语动词可以是持续性的，可以是短暂性动词。

sentence.Network_en: Mommy, you don't need to stay while we talk.
sentence.Network_cn: 妈妈,我们谈话时你不必陪着.

sentence.Network_en: It took her a while to get acclimatized to her new surroundings.
sentence.Network_cn: 她花了一段时间才适应了新的环境。

sentence.Network_en: Jim Coulters will mind the store while I'm away.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不在的时候吉姆·库尔特斯会照看店铺的。

She passed out while we were waiting for the doctor ., 我们正等大夫时 , 她晕死过去.

jx.jx_cn_mean: 值得某人花时间（精力等）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hwīl 'period of time', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wijl, German Weile; the conjunction is an abbreviation of Old English thā. hwīle the 'the while that'

encyclopedia.content: 计算机语言中的循环语句 计算机的一种基本循环模式。当满足条件时进入循环，不满足跳出。 BASIC语言中的当型循环 WHILE <条件> <语句体> end while do while <条件> <语句体> loop Pascal语言中的当型循环 while <条件> do <语句> C语言中的当型循环 do <语句> while(<条件>); while(<条件>) <语句>; C++语言中的当型循环 while(<条件>) <语句>; do &lt

entry.tran: (表示两件事同时发生)当…的时候，在…时
entry.def: If something happens while something else is happening, the two things are happening at the same time.

example.ex: They were grinning and watching while one man laughed and poured beer over the head of another...
example.tran: 当一个男人大笑着把啤酒倒在另一个人头上时，他们都在乐呵呵地看着。

example.ex: I sat on the settee to unwrap the package while he stood by...
example.tran: 我坐在长椅上打开包裹时他就站在旁边。

entry.tran: (表示某一件事是在另一件事发生过程中的某一时间点发生的)当…的时候，在…时
entry.def: If something happens while something else happens, the first thing happens at some point during the time that the second thing is happening.

example.ex: The two ministers have yet to meet, but may do so while in New York...
example.tran: 两位部长尚未会面，但可能会在纽约碰头。

example.ex: Never apply water to a burn from an electric shock while the casualty is still in contact with the electric current.
example.tran: 当被电击者还连着电时，千万不要把水弄到电击伤口上。

entry.def: You use while at the beginning of a clause to introduce information which contrasts with information in the main clause.

example.ex: Marianne was tempted to turn the large rooms into traditional French-style salons, while Howard was in favour of a typically English look...
example.tran: 玛丽安娜想把这些大房间弄成传统法式客厅的样子，但是霍华德喜欢典型的英式风格。

example.ex: The first two services are free, while the third costs £35.00.
example.tran: 前两项服务免费，但是第三项服务要花35英镑。

entry.def: You use while, before making a statement, in order to introduce information that partly conflicts with your statement.

example.ex: While the numbers of such developments are relatively small, the potential market is large...
example.tran: 尽管这种增长的数量相对较小，但是潜在的市场是巨大的。

example.ex: While the modelling business is by no means easy to get into, the good model, male or female, will always be in demand...
example.tran: 尽管模特行业绝不是那么容易进入的，但是好的模特，不论男女，总是需要的。

entry.def: A while is a period of time.

example.ex: They walked on in silence for a while...
example.tran: 他们默默地走了一会儿。

example.ex: He was married a little while ago...

entry.def: You use all the while in order to say that something happens continually or that it happens throughout the time when something else is happening.

example.ex: All the while the people at the next table watched me eat.
example.tran: 我吃东西的时候邻桌的人一直在看我。

means.word_mean: 1. a period of indeterminate length (usually short) marked by some action or condition;

sentences.sentence: "he was here for a little while"
"I need to rest for a piece"

means.word_mean: 在…期间, 当…的时候; 与…同时

sentences.en: While in prison, he wrote his first novel.
sentences.cn: 他在狱中写出了第一部小说。

jushi.english: While in prison, he wrote his first novel.
jushi.chinese: 他在狱中写出了第一部小说。

jushi.english: Motion is absolute while stagnation is relative.
jushi.chinese: 运动是绝对的,而静止是相对的。

jushi.english: While I admit his good point,I can see his shortcomings.
jushi.chinese: 虽然我承认他的优点,我还是能看到他的缺点。
